fields.description:
See https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-CIP-50

There are 3 comments in the review, but when I click "Jump To First Comment" and then keep clicking the "Next comment" arrow, I will never jump to this one: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-CIP-50#c3263

Which is for PercentBarColors.java, in case the link does not work for you too - is this another bug (permlink for revision comment not working)?
fields.summary: Next/previous comment arrows do not jump between file and general comments
Upgrade to non-beta atlassian-plugins

fields.description: One of the features that we'd like to see is the ability to oversee our review coverage - we'd like to be able to approach code review similar to how we handle test coverage (via say nCover); not all aspects of our codebase require the same degree of code review & obviously resources are limited.  We'd like to be able to leverage Fisheye / Crucible to target what software components we need to review & visualize the degree of coverage that has been applied.
fields.summary: Target what software components need to be reviewed

fields.description:
hi
i've been wondering if there is a way to have a report for every auther(auther of the review not the moderator or the reveiwer) include the defects that's been classifyed for him in every reviews he was the auther in, for the whole project..
fields.summary: review Report

fields.description: Move the XML-RPC libraries to the plugin
fields.summary: Confluence Light SCM plugin dependencies belong in plugin

fields.description: add an onWindowSizeChange listener
fields.summary: Adjust IFRAME size when the admin page is resized
REST API: Handle allowReviewersToJoin flag on review

fields.description: Currently RepositorySource checks that the repository is available when created and then never again. The Repository Source and all sources may become stateless singletons(?) so we need to check if the repsository is available each time it is asked, e.g. in getEngine or isAvailable
fields.summary: Make Repository source check if the engine is available.

fields.summary: NPE Closing Review

fields.description:
The idea is to have an ability to create additional customized classifications for comments that are not defects, they will be defined by project manager.

Originated from http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257285475&tstart=0#257285475
fields.summary: Ability to use customized classifications for comments (other than defects).

fields.description: Just like classifications allow comments to have customizable types, reviews should have user customizable outcomes. Just like comments, a review should be able to have multiple classifications that can be set to be mandatory or optional.
fields.summary: Review Outcomes

fields.description: Changes required in SCMFileExplorerInfo SCMFileHistoryExplorer and SCMSource
fields.summary: Use content manager to retrieve detailed file revisions

fields.description:
The comment I added here: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-CLOV-47#c3138
was originally only on line 105. After toggling to the Full Source, and then back to the diff, it is highlighting lines 105 and 106.

To reproduce this, 
* add a comment on that review above line 105.
* click show full source
* click show diff
fields.summary: Comment lines change after toggling to Full Source and back

fields.description: Our xml files claim that the xsd for metrics exists at http://www.cenqua.com/crucible/metrics-1, but it doesn't.
fields.summary: make metrics-config.xsd available online

fields.description:
Ok this is a major problem for us. We just realized that people have not been seeing all of the comments on their reviews. Not sure how often it has occurred, but we're watching for it now. This has been verified on multiple computers across multiple reviews.

The issue is that on some reviews, the "Next comment" does not actually go to the next comment, but to the current one. In the current review I'm looking at that has this problem, it occurs right after issue CRUC-538. I attached a screen shot - if I click on that "Next comment" button it doesn't do anything.

This is a very serious problem for us. Right now our workaround is to hide the source and show all comments, and work from there. We'd like to be able to trust the tool.

Note: again, this is with pre-commit patch-based checkins.
fields.summary: Serious: "Next comment" does not always work right

fields.description:
See screen shot. This happens a fair amount, where a single comment that was made will show up as duplicated later on. When the comment was made it did not show up as duplicated, only when the page is opened new. I haven't noticed any pattern in when this duplication occurs.

Note that this is in a patchfile-based pre-commit review.
fields.summary: Comments weirdly duplicated on occasion

fields.description: Add the ability to search on a filename (AuthenticationContextImpl.java for instance) and obtain a link to all reviews and comments performed on that file.
fields.summary: Summary Report & Searching by File

fields.description:
See screen shot. Seems like the regex for colorizing code needs some fixing up. Symbols that start with a keyword and then an uppercase letter get the keyword portion colorized blue. I've seen this with 'for' as well.

Expected: only when the entire word is a keyword should it get colorized as such.
fields.summary: Improper code colorization for C++

fields.description:
Add a navigation element to move between diff chunks within a file.

Things to consider:

* what level of context to start showing handles (>3 lines?)
* whether to hide by default (enable via diff options bar and global options bar) 
* user preference
* keyboard shortcut key (this needs to be added to fisheye as well)
fields.summary: Add diff chunk navigation links

fields.description: See attachment. This will often come up for one second after I hit the "Summarize",  "Close", or "Save" buttons on a review. It shows up, then on page refresh it goes away. I managed to screen-cap it the last time but I haven't been able to try clicking on the "show details"  link because the dialog disappears right away.
fields.summary: Error message often blinks onscreen for a second while saving forms

fields.description:
The autocomplete behavior of the reviewers box is pretty weird. If I type "A", I would expect everyone whose first or last name starts with 'A' to come first in the list, and sort everything alphabetically. Instead it looks like there is a naive db lookup that just does a match anywhere in the user's name, then presents the list in whatever order the db sent back. They look kind of random.

Expected: sort order should prioritize names to the top that are being matched from the front instead of the middle of the name.
fields.summary: Sort the auto-complete reviewers list more reasonably

fields.description:
Hitting ENTER while choosing reviewers not only accepts the choice but also closes the pane. I attached a screen shot showing what I mean. Repro:

1. Click on the Reviewers edit box
2. Start typing
3. Hit ENTER to accept the autocomplete
4. Autocomplete closes, saves, and then closes the review description pane entirely

Expected: while the autocomplete box is up, hitting ENTER should only add the current choice to the reviewers list, and not actually close the pane as if I had hit 'save'. I see this again and again with people on my team - they start typing, hit ENTER, swear, then have to reach for the mouse to go open it up again and then click to edit the description.

I realize that hitting "Tab" avoids this problem but that isn't the convention people are used to apparently.
fields.summary: Hitting ENTER while choosing reviewers closes the whole pane

fields.description: The drop down that lists the projects when creating a new code review case does not display the projects in sorted order. They are in "creation" order.
fields.summary: The list of projects (when selecting a project for review) should be in alphabetically order

fields.description:
We'd like to be able to select text in Crucible source windows (for copy-pasting into an IM window or email or the IDE or whatever). Of course, selecting any text will cause lines to get highlighted for a comment instead.

So what about a keyboard modifier? Say, if Shift is held down while dragging then it deactivates the line highlighting stuff and lets the browser do its ordinary selection/copy thing.
fields.summary: Have a way to select text in source windows

fields.description:
One of our coding standards is to keep stuff at 80 columns or less (generally) and a couple guys on the team would like a way to show this in Crucible.

So this is just a quick little request to add a vertical line at a configurable column width to the source view, same as many IDE's provide in their text editors. I suppose this would be a general FishEye/Crucible request as well.
fields.summary: Vertical line feature at x columns

fields.description:
There's no documentation on how to create a review using REST API - I know that 1.6 will include a lot of improvements in this manner so it would be good to give users a simple example.

Originated from http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257284842&#257284842
fields.summary: Document how to create a review using REST API

After placing moving Crucible to a path without a space characters it works without problems.

BTW if you put Crucible into a path with spaces on Unix it will fail to start.
fields.summary: Space character in installation path to Crucible disables remote API

fields.description:
FishEye was unable to process your request.

javax.el.ELException

com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.DbException: java.io.IOException: File closed: /opt/Atlassian/Crucible/var/data/data0.bin

You are running release CR1.5.1 FE1.5.1 (build-297 2008-04-24), please report your release number when reporting bugs.
fields.summary: 500 Server Issues - multiple issue generated by Creating a Review, Assigning a Moderator in Crucible

fields.description:
Some of check-in notices that are generated by Crucible are identified as Junk E-mail by exchange server.
Could you provide some possible reasons and resolutions?
Thanks,
fields.summary: Some of check-in notices that are generated by Crucible are identified as Junk E-mail by exchange server

fields.description: Added files currently display "no change", check copied file operation too.
fields.summary: Added files display "no change"

fields.description: Geoff and myself have notice it several  times now. ChangeSet and revision displays don't seem to display links to their associated reviews (until a Crucible reindex).
fields.summary: Crucible does not seem to be incrementally updating the FishEye cache

fields.description:
It would make working with the Admin interface a lot easier if you could choose how to sort the data on the Crucible Admin Repository list.

Currently you need to copy the data out into a separate program (such as excel) to easily sort the data to view trends.

One example to find out which repository has not run in a while etc.

Functionality similar to the Jira "Find Issues" display matrix would be great.
fields.summary: Ability to Sort Admin Repository list based on Last Updated, status and project
REST API: Return detailed information on review in one call - items, comments, reviewers, available actions
give better feedback when adding revisions to a review

fields.description:
When we display "no change" for a revision:
- select show source and comment on it, 
- then display show diff 
the comment is not displayed.

Fix: we need to display the above comment div when "no change" is displayed OR display source always?
fields.summary: If we display no change on a revision, comments made are hidden by default.

fields.description:
In a Perforce repository, there are users whose username are in lowercases and some are in mixed cases. 
The "force-lowercase" feature is enabled and all of the active Perforce users have user account in Crucible.
Creating a review based on the changeset being made by a user with lowercase username, the Author field is being populated expectedly. 
However, creating a review based on the changeset being made by a user with mixed cases username does not populate the Author field correctly. It appears that Crucible could not find a match and hence populated the Author field using creator's information instead.
fields.summary: Review's Author does not reflect the true repository's changeset Author whose username is in mixed cases

fields.description: see https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-328
fields.summary: Added files when stored show "No Change"

fields.description:
When The plugin becomes good enough (supported features) to be used practically instead of Crucible web UI, then it definitely makes sense to advertise it even more, as for many users having good IDE integration is a killer feature.
Good idea would be to include some info in some visible place in web UI about availability of IDE plugin and e.g. short info how to get it.

Would be great to have at least initial implementation in when 1.6 is released.
fields.summary: Add info about IDE integration in Web UI

fields.description: Finish implementation of ConfluenceChangelogExplorer
fields.summary: Confluence: implement change set paging

fields.description:
Change sets returned from scm need to be filtered by author (and other things?)

Related changes need to be heuristically grouped.

Filtering can only be done when light SCM wayback support is added.
fields.summary: Implement change set filtering and grouping

fields.description:
Should search title and description for substring and/or regex

This will be immediately useful to the JIRA FishEye Plugin (e.g. [FISH-158|http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/FISH-158])
fields.summary: Add "Search for Review" functionality to Crucible remote API

fields.description: See ConfluenceDetailedFileRevision
fields.summary: Confluence: get revision comments

fields.description: Crowd 1.4.4 contains some fixes that we would like to have in JIRA Studio. Please upgrade to latest (1.4.4) Crowd client libraries.
fields.summary: Upgrade to crowd-integration-client 1.4.4

fields.description: I have somehow gotten myself to join the same review twice. When the 'allow anyone to join' option is on the reivew, I still had the 'join review' button visible even though I was already joined by the author.
fields.summary: User can join review multiple times

fields.description:
At present, we have these classes:

Source -- an abstract class which can get details of individual revisions of files, and understands some things about their relationships
SCMSource -- abstract class, extends Source, adds methods needed to explore the structure of files in a repository, and has default implementations for many of the methods on Source

the various LightSCM implementations extend SCMSource, while PatchSource extends Source.

This needs to be refactored, perhaps as:

interface SCMSource
interface SCMNavigator
interface SCMChangeSetNavigator(?)
abstract Source implements SCMSource
abstract AbstractNavigator extends Source implements SCMNavigator -- (this would be a place for common implementations of navigator methods -- bad idea?)
PatchSource extends Source -- unchanged
<XXX>SCMSource extends AbstractNavigator
fields.summary: Refactor Source, SCMSource into interfaces and abstract base classes

fields.description: Put all the interfaces available to plugin authors into a separate jar, so it is clear what they can link against.
fields.summary: Create separate API jar

fields.description:
Code review comment replies saved as as drafts are deleted when the review is completed.

To reproduce:
- Reply to an existing message. Use "Save as Draft" to save it as a draft comment
- Complete the review by clicking the "Complete" button

Result:
- Review is marked completed. All draft comment replies are deleted.

Expected Result:
- Ask if the user would like to post some or all of the draft comments
fields.summary: Draft comment replies are deleted when completing review

fields.description: Crucible can now store the contents of file revisions with the review on the server. This is important for audit purposes (and in future for packaging a review for export) It insulates the review from loss of connection to a repository.
fields.summary: Document store revisions with review

fields.description: don't show the source prefix 'FE:' 'FILESYSTEM:' etc -- enforce uniqueness of source names across all types
fields.summary: Don't make source type visible in URLs or elsewhere

fields.description: Usually you can add comments to a crucible review by clicking in the source code area. This add comment box doesn't appear in firefox 3.
fields.summary: Add comment box doesn't appear in Firefox 3

fields.description:
At the moment we don't detect moved files in patches. We're not sure if there is enough information in a unified diff patch for us to know if it has been moved we need to investigate.

see CR-FE-311 and CRUC-284
fields.summary: look at isMoved detection for patches

fields.description: It would be fantastic to be able to see what percentage of a project / repositories code had been code reviewed over time within crucible.
fields.summary: Code Review Coverage Metrics

fields.description: After selecting a patch to review, for some reason, the review fields are cleared, which is rather annoying.  I generally like to fill in the title, description, reviewers, etc., then select what I'm going to review, but this bug makes me do it twice (no, I don't learn from my mistakes)
fields.summary: Review fields cleared after selecting a patch

fields.description:
Since it is more congruent with the 80% usecase:

instead of the "Summarize" button changing the state to SUMMARIZE and showing the Summarize screen,
just show the screen and then let them hit "Close".

This means we skip the summarize state which is not used 80% of the time anyway.
fields.summary: Make Summarize a screen not a state

fields.description: ie. from being in the 'to summarise' filter, if you click summarise, then go back to the dashboard, it is still open, but only viewable in the 'open' and 'all' filters
fields.summary: clicking summarise without clicking close makes the review 'disappear' from the workflow

fields.description: when viewing an abandoned review, the page title includes "dead" but it should say "abandoned". e.g. see https://studio.atlassian.com/source/cru/CR-JST-61/review
fields.summary: Page title says "dead" for a review that has been abandoned

fields.description:
see the attached screenshot.

Interesting discovery: the more reviews is in the search result, the narrower rendered table is.
With c.a. 2000 reviews it's really narrow. With 100 reviews it's wider.
With 12 reviews it's almost good.
FF 3 always renders horizontal scrollbar in the bottom of this report.

Bug does not occur with Firefox 2 or Opera 9.27 (there is even no horizontal scrollbar)
fields.summary: Invalid rendering of Search Comments report (table part)

fields.description:
This improvement is specially useful for people who have many (say 100 or so) users in their Crucible instance.
Currently sorting is somewhat strange. Take a look at the attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Sort users in drop down menu - e.g. in "Search comments" screen
you can link a review to itself

fields.description:
Ability to Create, Save and Share Custom Filters within Crucible.

*From a customer:*
I originally didn't understand how the Custom Filter worked. When I used it, it never returned any results whatever I selected. I realised that I was using the Title field as the title of my filter rather than the title of the review and I would have thought have you could create new filters which you would save to use later but it doesn't seem possible.

It would be nice to create your own filters which you could select when you log in later.
fields.summary: Create, Save & Share saved Custom Filters

fields.description: At present it is not clear when you open a review and look at the statement of objectives whether there is any text which is hidden due to it being "folded up".  Even something as simple as adding "..." would do to signal this.  The problem is compounded by the fact that you get a 'plus' to expand it even when there isn't anything to expand (mentioned in CRUC-463)
fields.summary: Make it more obvious that the statement of objectives is "folded up"

fields.description:
It's hard for an author to keep track of which comments on their code they think they have addressed, and which still need ongoing discussion -- that is, one response may be "OK, I've changed that", needing no further input, while another may be "Would it be OK if I did X?" which needs to be revisited when a  reviewer responds.

We should allow comment threads to be marked with a metric "Resolution" and add an "expand files with unresolved threads" command.
fields.summary: Allow comment threads to be marked as 'answered'/'resolved'

fields.description:
Record whether each participant has seen each comment.

- record this in the notification table
- mark as read when a user clicks in the comment, or navigates to the comment via the keyboard
- have a read/unread marker on the comment which can be used to mark a comment as unread again
fields.summary: Record whether comments have been read on a per user basis

fields.description:
When you edit a defect comment and remove the defect classification, the defect attributes are still shown: http://img.skitch.com/20080618-x59cc86khkkb78xiuxyridy6u6.jpg

When the defect flag is set to false we should remove the values of metrics related to defects
fields.summary: A comment which was a defect, but is no longer, still shows the defect attributes

fields.description: A light SCM repo should be able to specify that its type of repository doesn't have the concept of a branch. All branch-related UI should be hidden for that repo.
fields.summary: Ability to specify that Branches are not supported

fields.description:
Currently Crucible uses embedded HSQL DB. There is no way to deploy it with other standard (supporting JDBC) database (RDBMS).
It causes some anxiety among certain customers as they are forced to use another DB engine which they may not like.
With HSQL it is somewhat problematic to achieve more advanced configurations supporting high-availability, replication, etc.
fields.summary: Support standard (non-embedded) SQL databases

fields.description:
"Open for N days" seems to be derived from the creation date of the review so if a review has been in draft mode for a long period, once issued it appears to have been open for a long time.

http://skitch.com/michaelstudman/p3ye/cr-cip-5-cij-103-testrunexplorer-does-not-display-a-method-if-it-is-empty-review
fields.summary: "Open for N days" is misleading

fields.description:
Originated from http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257282628&

Page http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Crucible+REST+API+Usage+Example doesn't have any info on how to create a review using remote API, as we improve REST service the documentation should get improved (1.6 will include a lot more features here).
fields.summary: Create documentation on creating reviews using remote API

fields.description: it would be really useful to be able to have say the plugin team in a crucible group that i could just assign to be reviewers all at once sometimes, instead of looking up and adding each person
fields.summary: Allow adding a group as moderators/reviewers of reviews

fields.description: i set up a review and then accidentally uploaded the wrong patch. didn't see any way to delete that patch so it wouldn't show up for download at the top of the page
fields.summary: Uploaded patches can't be deleted

fields.description: if i am editing a review by adding title, reviewers, objectives and then go from the default "changesets" tab to the "patch" tab, everything entered disappears. frustrating and unexpected
fields.summary: Changing tab while editing review deletes details

fields.description:
We have FishEye/Crucible 1.5.1 integrated Perforce and JIRA. It's fine for us to add issue ID in Perforce submit description, and create code review based on the changeset in Perforce. I know it's regular usage of Crucible.

I want to know if I can use Crucible to create a review linked to a JIRA issue, but not based a repository, and from JIRA we can see and link the code review in Crucible.
And can we create a new code review from JIRA, not based on an existing FishEye link?

Thanks,
fields.summary: Link Crucible with issue in JIRA

fields.description:
The summarize and close emails should include all the reviews comments.

Enable a review summary to be mailed out at any time.
fields.summary: Summary Email Improvements

fields.description: See attachment, this list IMHO should be sorted.
fields.summary: Sort list of repositories alphabetically on "Add project" page

fields.description: This would be a general GC thread that would clean up database cruft as well
fields.summary: Make a GC thread to clean up stored file revisions

fields.description: Loading the "Create Review " page takes a very long time on a medium-size repository ( ~ 200K changelists and 48GB in size). This occur in both IE6 and IE7. There is no extra delay when creating a review in FireFox browser.
fields.summary: Poor performance when creating a review via Internet Explorer browser

fields.description: It's hard to add multiple users to the same group/groups - you need to go to each user and repeat the same process. It should be possible to open a group and add (or remove) multiple users to it (for example from a list, or by the names). Make it similar (or better) than in JIRA.
fields.summary: Improve built-in group management

fields.description: Some Statement of Objectives are short enough that expanding the statement just changes the expand button from a plus to a minus and no new information is shown. In these cases, it would be best if the expand button were disabled or omitted. Being able to click creates an expectation that something will happen.
fields.summary: Disable or omit expand button on short Statement of Objectives

fields.description:
occurs because someone is holding on to UserManager permanently

https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CRC-242

related to https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CRC-245 ?
fields.summary: "File closed: var\data\data0.bin" after backups

fields.description: A single comment can sometimes be rendered twice -- these comments are *not* duplicated in the DB, but are displayed twice, e.g. see https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-240#c1799
fields.summary: Line comments are sometimes rendered twice

fields.description:
If the default browser font is too big, or there are too many reviews, the numbers (and the text) in the 'my reviews' panel in the dashboard gets cut off, due to overflow hidden. 
see screenshot.
fields.summary: numbers in the 'My Reviews' panel in dashboard is hidden/cut off if longer than the width of the panel

fields.description:
One of reviewers has already commented on the review, one has not.
I would like to address this comment in Summarize, but I am still waiting for the second user's input.

I would like to be able to create draft Summarize comment so I don't forget what I wanted to say.
fields.summary: Ability to edit draft Summarize comment before Summarizing the review

fields.description:
I created a Crucible review with links (http://...) to bamboo build and a snapshot image.
It would be much nicer if I could specify those links using wiki syntax ( [ label | http://URL ] )
fields.summary: Support wiki markup in Crucible comments

fields.description: like IDEA does (see attached screenshots)
fields.summary: show authorname next to revision in revision dropdowns
crucible doesn't create default permission scheme when creating a blank db

fields.description:
you fill in the login details, click login, and it takes you back to the login page. 

it should tell you that the repository doesnt exist
fields.summary: creating a review from a changeset with a non-existent repo keeps redirecting to the login screen

fields.description: Receiving two notification emails for crucible events
fields.summary: two notifcation emails sent

fields.description:
I am requesting a review for user interface change.
It would be very convenient to just attach a screenshot.
fields.summary: Allow adding a screenshot as an attachment to a review

fields.description:
A Crucible project's title with Japanese character, for example "テスト" is being updated. The notification's subject render the Japanese characters as "?" instead whereas the email content (with Japanese characters too) render correctly. See screenshot, {{japanese_screenshot.JPG}}.
Tested with other non-ASCII character such as the German and the notification's subject render appropriately. See screenshot, {{german_screenshot.JPG}}.
fields.summary: Japanese language translation problem on email notification's subject

fields.description:
I've created a Crucible project that corresponds with a Jira project and used the same key as the Jira project code (in this case, COW). When fixing a Jira issue we include the issue reference in the commit, and when we create a review we generally just use the commit message unchanged /as the review statement of objects. Crucible 'incorrectly' autolinks the issue reference when the statement of objects are displayed as a link to another Crucible review.

I'm somewhat loathe to create a Crucible project key like CR-COW, it feels a bit clumsy and awkward and will could become nasty when linking to comments in a review (e.g. CR-COW-45-124 as suggested by CRUC-97).

Do you have any suggestions on how to deal with situation?
fields.summary: Best practise for project key naming

fields.description: There is scope for improving common infrastructure for crucible tests removing duplication and providing common test startup environment. For example for testing Actions a DummyHttpRequest now exists in two places.
fields.summary: put common test infrastucture in one place and remove dumplicates

fields.description: It would be sweet if I could jump between next/previous comments in an issue using the j and k keys (like Gmail) when the comment text field doesn't have focus.
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcut support

fields.description: Search results in a tiny table doesn't really work for me. It should either be a sortable summary table (a la jira) or google style results rather than a bit of both.
fields.summary: Revisit search result layout

fields.description:
Crucible's workflow (for want of a better word) and more generally it's terminology are the most common cause of confusion from Crucible users, especially first time users. There are a range of relatively small changes that should go a long way to addressing most problems. 

* "Approve" regularly confuses users, it was changed to "start review" but more changes are required to make the default flow of a review obvious to a first time user.
* Make Moderator's optional - i.e. the default workflow/permissions would be more like JIRA, any authenticated user can do any action
* Rename Moderator to something less formal i.e. "Lead Reviewer"

Close as duplicate any similar issues and update this one with the suggestions/feedback.
fields.summary: Simplify workflow & terminology

fields.description:
Allow people without accounts to be invited to a review. Especially handy for new installations, evaluations, and public instances.

Could work something like:
* click invite
* enter email address(es)
* send a mail with link to the review and a link to signup that redirects to the review (and adds user as reviewer).
fields.summary: Invite to review

fields.description:
We have recently upgraded our Crucible and Fisheye installation to 1.5.1 but since then no Crucible email notifications have been sent.  

We can send test emails using the facility on the Server Setting page and these are received OK.

No other settings have been changed.
fields.summary: Not sending email notifications after Crucible and Fisheye upgrade

fields.description: After deleting a user, Crucible will only show the username in review history.
fields.summary: Full Name to be available after deleting a user

fields.description: currently only the changeset tab contains a remove all revisions link. Need to add that link for each tab.
fields.summary: create 'remove all revision' link for all tabs under 'manage files'
'Expand Commented' appears when there are general comments but no revision comments

fields.description: Provide functionality for REST API to retrieve reviews based n dashboard-like filters
fields.summary: REST API: Get review list based on predefined and custom filters
